{{Day}}

==Events==
* [[565]] &ndash; [[Patriarch Eutychius of Constantinople|Eutychius]] is deposed as [[Patriarch of Constantinople]] by [[John Scholasticus]].
* [[613]] &ndash; [[Constantine III (Byzantine emperor)|Constantine]] (8-month-old) is crowned as co-emperor (''[[Caesar (title)|Caesar]]'') by his father [[Heraclius]] at [[Constantinople]].
*[[1506]] &ndash; The first contingent of 150 [[Swiss Guard]]s arrives at the [[Vatican City|Vatican]].
*[[1517]] &ndash; The [[Ottoman Empire]] under [[Selim I]] defeats the [[Mamluk Sultanate (Cairo)|Mamluk Sultanate]] and captures present-day Egypt at the [[Battle of Ridaniya]].
*[[1521]] &ndash; Emperor [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]] opens the [[Diet of Worms]]
*[[1555]] &ndash; The [[Ava Kingdom]] falls to the [[Taungoo Dynasty]] in what is now present-day [[Burma]].
*[[1689]] &ndash; The [[Convention Parliament (1689)|Convention Parliament]] convenes to determine whether  [[James II of England|James II and VII]], the last [[Roman Catholic Church|Roman Catholic]] monarch of England, Ireland and Scotland, had vacated the thrones when he fled to France in [[1688]].
*[[1824]] &ndash; The [[Ashantis]] defeat British forces in the [[Gold Coast (British colony)|Gold Coast]].
*[[1849]] &ndash; [[Second Anglo-Sikh War]]: The [[Siege of Multan]] ends after nine months when the last [[Sikhism|Sikh]] defenders of [[Multan]], [[Punjab region|Punjab]], surrender.
*[[1863]] &ndash; The [[January Uprising]] breaks out in Poland, [[Lithuania]] and [[Belarus]]. The aim of the national movement is to regain [[Polish–Lithuanian–Ruthenian Commonwealth]] from occupation by Russia.
*[[1877]] &ndash; [[Arthur Tooth]], an [[Anglicanism|Anglican]] [[clergyman]] is taken into custody after being prosecuted for using [[Ritualism|ritualist]] practices.
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Anglo-Zulu War]]: [[Battle of Isandlwana]] &ndash; [[Zulu people|Zulu]] troops decisively defeat British troops.
*  1879 &ndash; Anglo-Zulu War: [[Battle of Rorke's Drift]] &ndash; 139 [[British Army|British soldiers]] successfully defend their [[garrison]] against an onslaught by three to four thousand [[Zulu people|Zulu]] warriors.
*[[1889]] &ndash; [[Columbia Phonograph]] is formed in Washington, D.C.
*[[1890]] &ndash; The [[United Mine Workers of America]] is founded in [[Columbus, Ohio]].
*[[1899]] &ndash; Leaders of six Australian colonies meet in [[Melbourne]] to discuss confederation.
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[Edward VII]] is proclaimed King after the death of his mother, [[Queen Victoria]].
*[[1905]] &ndash; [[Bloody Sunday (1905)|Bloody Sunday]] in [[Saint Petersburg]], beginning of the 1905 revolution.
*[[1906]] &ndash; {{SS|Valencia}} runs aground on rocks on [[Vancouver Island]], [[British Columbia]], killing more than 130.
*[[1915]] &ndash; Over 600 people are killed in [[Guadalajara]], Mexico, when a train [[Guadalajara train disaster|plunges off the tracks]] into a deep canyon.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[President of the United States|President]] [[Woodrow Wilson]] of the still-neutral United States calls for "peace without victory" in Europe.
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Act Zluky]] is signed, unifying the [[Ukrainian People's Republic]] and the [[West Ukrainian National Republic]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Ramsay MacDonald]] becomes the first [[Labour Party (UK)|Labour]] [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]].
*[[1927]] &ndash; [[Teddy Wakelam]] gives the first live radio commentary of a [[association football|football]] match anywhere in the world, between [[Arsenal F.C.]] and [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] at [[Arsenal Stadium|Highbury]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[British Empire|British]] and [[Commonwealth of Nations|Commonwealth]] troops capture [[Tobruk]] from [[Regio Esercito|Italian forces]] during [[Operation Compass#Tobruk|Operation Compass]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] commence [[Operation Shingle]], an assault on [[Anzio]], Italy.
*[[1946]] &ndash; In [[Iran]], [[Qazi Muhammad]] declares the independent people's [[Republic of Mahabad]] at [[Chuwarchira Square]] in the Kurdish city of [[Mahabad]]. He is the new president and [[Hadschi Baba Scheich]] is the [[prime minister]].
*  1946 &ndash; Creation of the ''Central Intelligence Group'', forerunner of the [[Central Intelligence Agency]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[KTLA]], the first commercial [[television station]] west of the [[Mississippi River]], begins operation in [[Hollywood, California]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Israel]] withdraws from the [[Sinai Peninsula]].
*  1957 &ndash; The New York City "Mad Bomber", [[George P. Metesky]], is arrested in [[Waterbury, Connecticut]] and is charged with planting more than 30 bombs.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Knox Mine disaster]]: Water breaches the River Slope Mine near [[Pittston, Pennsylvania]] in [[Port Griffith, Pennsylvania|Port Griffith]]; 12 miners are killed.
*[[1962]] &ndash; The [[Organization of American States]] suspends [[Cuba]]'s membership.
*[[1963]] &ndash; The [[Élysée Treaty]] of cooperation between France and Germany is signed by [[Charles de Gaulle]] and [[Konrad Adenauer]].
*[[1968]] &ndash; [[Apollo 5]] lifts off carrying the first [[Lunar module]] into space.
*  1968 &ndash; [[Operation Igloo White]], a US electronic surveillance system to stop [[People's Army of Vietnam|communist infiltration]] into [[South Vietnam]] begins installation.
*[[1969]] &ndash; A gunman attempts to [[Brezhnev assassination attempt|assassinate Soviet leader Leonid Brezhnev]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Boeing 747]], the world's first "jumbo jet", enters commercial service for launch customer [[Pan American Airways]] with its maiden voyage from [[John F. Kennedy International Airport]] to [[London Heathrow Airport]].
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Singapore Declaration]], one of the two most important documents to the [[uncodified constitution]] of the [[Commonwealth of Nations]], is issued.
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Supreme Court of the United States]] delivers its decisions in [[Roe v. Wade]] and [[Doe v. Bolton]], legalizing elective [[abortion]] in all fifty states.
*  1973 &ndash; The crew of [[Apollo 17]] addresses a joint session of Congress after the completion of the final Apollo moon landing mission.
*  1973 &ndash; A chartered [[Boeing 707]] explodes in flames upon landing at [[Kano Airport]], [[Nigeria]], killing 176.
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[Apple Macintosh]], the first consumer computer to popularize the [[computer mouse]] and the [[graphical user interface]], is introduced during Super Bowl XVIII with its famous ''"[[1984 (commercial)|1984]]"'' [[television commercial]].
*[[1987]] &ndash; [[Pennsylvania]] politician [[R. Budd Dwyer]] shoots and kills himself during a televised [[press conference]], leading to debates on boundaries in journalism.
*  1987 &ndash; [[Philippines|Philippine]] security forces [[Mendiola massacre|open fire]] on a crowd of 10,000–15,000 demonstrators at [[Malacañan Palace]], [[Manila]], killing 13.
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Robert Tappan Morris]] is convicted of releasing the [[Morris worm|1988 Internet Computer worm]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; [[Gulf War]]: Three [[SCUD]]s and one [[Patriot missile]] hit [[Ramat Gan]] in [[Israel]], injuring 96 people. Three elderly people die of heart attacks.
*[[1992]] &ndash; Rebel forces occupy [[Zaire]]'s national radio station in [[Kinshasa]] and broadcast a demand for the government's resignation.
*  1992 &ndash; [[Space Shuttle program]]: Dr. [[Roberta Bondar]] becomes the first Canadian woman and the first neurologist in space
*[[1995]] &ndash; [[Israeli–Palestinian conflict]]: [[Beit Lid massacre]] &ndash; In central [[Israel]], near [[Netanya]], two [[suicide bomber]]s from the [[Gaza Strip]] blow themselves up at a military transit point killing 19 Israelis.
*[[1999]] &ndash; Australian missionary [[Graham Staines]] and his two sons are burned alive by radical Hindus while sleeping in their car in Eastern India.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Kmart]] becomes the largest retailer in United States history to file for [[Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection]].
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Evo Morales]] is inaugurated as President of [[Bolivia]], becoming the country's first indigenous president.
*[[2007]] &ndash; At least 88 people are killed when [[22 January 2007 Baghdad bombings|two car bombs]] explode in the [[Bab Al-Sharqi]] market in central [[Baghdad]], [[Iraq]].
